content.text:
# National Society of Film Critics Award for Best Foreign Language Film__disambig_1

The National Society of Film Critics Award for Best Foreign Language Film  is one of the annual awards given by the National Society of Film Critics since its inception in 1990.
Winners
1990s
{| class="wikitable" width="95%" cellpadding="5"
|-
!width="100"|Year

!width="200"|Original title
!width="200"|Country
!width="200"|Director

|-
|style="text-align:center;"| 1991 || The Double Life of Veronique || La Double Vie de Véronique || France / Poland ||  Krzysztof Kieślowski
|-
|style="text-align:center;"| 1992 || Raise the Red Lantern || Da hong deng long gao gao gua || China || Zhang Yimou
|-
|style="text-align:center;"| 1993 || The Story of Qiu Ju || Qiu Ju da guan si || China || Zhang Yimou
|-
|style="text-align:center;"| 1994 || Three Colors: Red || Trois couleurs: Rouge || France / Poland || Krzysztof Kieślowski
|-
|style="text-align:center;"| 1995 || Wild Reeds || Les Roseaux sauvages || France || André Téchiné
|-
|style="text-align:center;"| 1996 || colspan="2"| La Cérémonie || France || Claude Chabrol
|-

Superlatives
Countries with more than two wins
*France – 8
*Finland - 3
*Germany – 3
*Poland - 3
*Romania – 3
Directors with multiple wins
*Aki Kaurismäki (Finland) – 3
*Olivier Assayas (France) – 2
*Alfonso Cuarón (Mexico) – 2
*Krzysztof Kieślowski (Poland) – 2
*Cristian Mungiu (Romania) – 2
*Zhang Yimou (China) – 2
